catalog.title: What Does God Have To Say
catalog.author: Tim Dilena
catalog.description: A Biblical worldview from A to Z. This book is a compelling call to embrace God's perspective and rediscover the enduring truths of the Bible for a foundational biblical worldview

catalog.title: The Chronicles of Narnia
catalog.author: C.S. Lewis
catalog.description: Journeys into magical realms, battles between good and evil, talking creatures, and more, await readers of all ages in The Chronicles of Narnia..

catalog.title: The Cross And The Switchblade
catalog.author: David Wilkerson, Elizabeth Sherrill, John Sherrill
catalog.description: The dramatic and inspiring true story of a small town minister called to help inner city kids everyone else believed were beyond hope.

catalog.title: The Hiding Place
catalog.author: Corrie Ten Boom, Elizabeth Sherrill, John Sherrill
catalog.description: In World War II Corrie Ten Boom and her family risked their lives to help Jews and underground workers escape from the Nazis, and for their work they were tested in the infamous Nazi death camps. Only Corrie among her family survived to tell the story of how faith ultimately triumphs over evil.

catalog.title: A Grief Observed
catalog.author: C.S. Lewis
catalog.description: A Grief Observed by C.S. Lewis is a profound exploration of the human experience of loss and mourning

catalog.author: George Orwell
catalog.description: A totalitarian government controls everything in an imagined future. When a government worker starts to think for himself, he faces dire consequences.

catalog.title: God's Smuggler
catalog.author: by Brother Andrew, John Sherrill, Elizabeth Sherrill
catalog.description: In this electrifying real-life story, readers are gripped from the first page by the harrowing account of a young man who risked his life to smuggle Bibles through the borders of closed nations.

catalog.title: The Color Purple
catalog.author: Alice Walker
catalog.description: Letters between two sisters, one a missionary in Africa, and the other trapped in an abusive marriage in Georgia, shed light on the lived experience of rural African American women.

catalog.title: Into Thin Air: A Personal Account of the Mt. Everest Disaster
catalog.author: Jon Krakauer
catalog.description: A first-hand account of the 1996 Mount Everest disaster, in which four expedition teams were trapped by a deadly storm.

catalog.title: Parable of the Sower
catalog.author: Octavia E. Butler
catalog.description: Set in a bleak near-future California, 18-year-old Lauren suffers from hyperempathyâ€”she feels others' pain as well as her own.
